data.content:
Động từ
để nước dãi ở miệng chảy ra
the baby's just dribbled down my tie
đứa bé vừa để nước dãi chảy ra cà vạt của tôi
[làm cho] chảy nhỏ giọt, [làm cho] chảy thành dòng nhỏ
water dribbling out of a tap
nước chảy nhỏ giọt từ vòi
(thể thao) rê (quả bóng)
Danh từ
một lượng rất ít, một vài giọt (chất lỏng)
(thể thao) sự rê bóng

verb
dribbles; dribbled; dribbling
always followed by an adverb or preposition
[no obj] :to fall or flow in small drops
Coffee dribbled [=trickled] down the side of the mug.
Juice dribbled down his chin.
[+ obj] :to let (a liquid) fall in small drops
She accidentally dribbled wine onto the rug.
Dribble olive oil over the warm bread before serving.
[no obj] :to let saliva or another liquid drip or trickle from your mouth
The baby dribbled [=drooled] down the back of her dad's shirt.
to move a ball or puck forward by tapping, bouncing, or kicking it [no obj]
She dribbled across the basketball court. [+ obj]
He skillfully dribbled the soccer ball towards the goal.
noun
plural dribbles
[count] a small flow of liquid
He wiped a dribble of juice from the corner of the baby's mouth.
dribbles of blood
an act of moving a ball or puck forward by tapping, bouncing, or kicking it
She gave the ball a dribble before passing it. - see also double dribble
